action.action-desc: Mr. O'Rourke (for himself and Mr. Khanna) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit a candidate for election to the office or Representative in Congress or Senator from accepting contributions from any political committee other than an authorized committee of the candidate and from establishing a leadership PAC.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No PAC Act.

section.header: Prohibition on acceptance of contributions from PACs by candidates for Representative or Senator

subsection.text: Section 315 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 (52 U.S.C. 30116) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Prohibitions relating to certain political committees

paragraph.text: A candidate for election for the office of Senator or Representative in, or Delegate or Resident Commissioner to, the Congress, may not accept a contribution with respect to the election from any political committee other than an authorized committee of the candidate.

A candidate for election for the office of Senator or Representative in, or Delegate or Resident Commissioner to, the Congress may not establish a leadership PAC (as defined in subparagraph (B) of section 304(i)(8)).

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to elections occurring after 2018.
